intro: Chaetocalyx parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered hook-leaf vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hooked or curled appearance at the base. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky areas.
